head.title: Treasury Bill Auctions Set for This Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury Bill Auctions Set for This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.
At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was at 4.91 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.
At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was at 4.91 percent.
The rate on the six-month issue was 5.02 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue was 4.82 percent.
The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TOMORROW
Lincoln, Neb., Electric, $278.5 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
Napa Valley, Calif., Unified School District, $90 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
San Francisco, $149.8 million of certificates of participation. Competitive.
Virginia Housing Development Authority, $140.5 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
WEDNESDAY
Lawrence Township, Ind., school building, $52 million of debt securities. Competitive.
THURSDAY
Delaware, $175 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Arizona Health Facilities Authority, $600 million of revenue bonds for Banner Health. Morgan Stanley.
Baltimore County, Md., $68.8 million of revenue bonds. Ziegler Capital Markets.
California Educational Facilities Authority, $200 million of debt securities for the University of Southern California. Morgan Stanley.
Central California Joint Power Health, $327 million of debt securities for Community Medical Centers. Citigroup Global Markets.
Chicago, $600 million of general obligation bonds. Merrill Lynch.
Cincinnati Water, $80 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
Clark County, Nev., airport systems, $152 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
Clark County, Nev., $56.7 million of airport system subordinate revenue bonds for Las Vegas-McCarran International Airport. Siebert Brandford Shank.
Foothill-De Anza Community College District, $100 million of general obligation bonds for Santa Clara County, Calif. Morgan Stanley.
Fredericksburg Economic Development Medicorp, $80 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
Illinois Finance Authority, $117.9 million of revenue bonds for Palos Community Hospital. Goldman Sachs.
Indianapolis Public Improvement Bond Bank, $70 million of revenue bonds. Morgan Stanley.
Louisiana Public Facilities Authority, $190.9 million of revenue bonds for Tulane University of Louisiana. Morgan Stanley.
Manatee County, Fla., school board, $61 million of certificates of participation. Citigroup Global Markets.
Minnesota Housing Finance Agency, $112.5 million of debt securities. UBS Securities.
Nebraska Investment Finance Agency, $50 million of debt securities. Lehman Brothers.
Oklahoma Development Finance Agency, $247 million of debt securities for St. John's Health. Citigroup Global Markets.
Tennessee Housing Development Agency, $120 million of homeownership program bonds. Morgan Keegan.
Winston-Salem, N.C., water and sewer, $58 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
